scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes CAdES (ISO 14533-1:2014) in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of CAdES is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
ISO has defined a clear procedure to develop its standards. It consists in a 6-steps process where everyone who is interested can participate. However, if you want to participate, you have to contact your national standards body and you have to be approved for joining the Technical committee (TC) who will develop the standard. ISO has defined the roadmap of standards, it is composed of 6 steps as before said. For the approval of a standard the two-thirds majority of P-members of TC is needed. If the result is negative, the document is returned to TC/SC for further studied.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
As defined on the TC standardisation, only TC members are involved in the development of ISO standards. A review is carried out to arrange the consensus firstly within the TC members and subsequently is reviewed by the different ISO member bodies. However, it cannot be considered a public review, because only TC members can participate.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
There are no disclosures of ISO IPR Database to identify the licensing under the specification. ISO 14533-1:2014 (CAdES) is not listed in ISO/IEC/ITU Common Patent policy, so it cannot be confirmed that the specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.

ISO patents:
https://www.iso.org/iso-standards-and-patents.html 

ISO standards and patents IPR database:
http://isotc.iso.org/livelink/livelink/13622347/Patents_database.xls?func=doc.Fetch&nodeId=13622347

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The term of CAdES was first introduced in 2005 as CMS Advanced Electronic Signatures (CAdES) on ETSI Technical specifications. In 2008 was introduced in IETF webpage as a copy of the ETSI specification. So, it is mature enough for its use in the development of products and services.

ETSI TS 101 733 V1.6.3 (2005-09):
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/01.06.03_60/ts_101733v010603p.pdf

IETF CAdES:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5126.html

eSignature standards:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eSignature+standards

criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The purpose of CAdES is to foster the use of electronic signature.  Therefore, it is clear that it reduces the administrative burden by making signing possible electronically.

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
CAdES is a group of extensions to Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) signed data which purpose is to make advanced electronic signatures. One profile of CAdES is CAdES-LTA, it is a signature conformant which has one or more long-term-validation attributes that guarantee the preservation of the authenticity of the signature. Moreover, a resulting property of CAdES is that electronically signed documents can remain valid for long periods, even if the signer or verifying party later attempts to deny the validity of the signature.

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

statement: After carrying out information retrieval, no document or study has been found assessing the CAdES in terms of efficiency or effectiveness.

criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
CAdES (ISO 14533-1:2014) is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, it can define the interoperability aspects of the "e-Seal Preservation Service" and "e-Signature Preservation Service" ABBs of the EIRA Technical Infrastructure View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

statement:

CAdES conformance testing:
https://signatures-conformance-checker.etsi.org/pub/index.shtml

CAdES conformance testing 2:

criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
After searching in the different official European websites, there is no evidence of any cross-border project that uses CAdES (ISO 14533-1:2014) nor explicit agreements involving the usage of the specification. However, the specification CAdES from ETSI, is involved in some cross-border projects as "Analysis of standards related to Trust Service Providers" developed by ENISA (European Union Agency for Network and Information Security) which is a centre of network and information security expertise for the EU, its member states, the private sector and Europeâs citizens. 

ENISA project:
https://www.enisa.europa.eu/publications/tsp_standards_2015/at_download/fullReport

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
CAdES (ISO 14533-1:2014) is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of CAdES (ISO 14533-1:2014) within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

CENELEC search tool catalogue:
https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of CAdES is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of CAdES is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
CAdES does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but defines an electronic signature format. 

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/101700_101799/101733/02.01.01_60/ts_101733v020101p.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of CAdES is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html

CAdES ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/64756.html

CAdES ETSI reference:
